title: Big Trouble In Little China 720p DD 5.1 [1986] Adventure doesn't
description:
Ahoy!  Pirates... It's  SeattleBeach  again bringing you one of my all time favorite movies  or as Jack Burton always says:  'This is Jack Burton in the Pork Chop Express, and I'm talkin' to whoever's listenin' out there'  You should enjoy this one If you haven't seen it,  you're in for a great ride, if you have, this is a very nice copy!  so without further ado I present: BIG TROUBLE in LITTLE CHINA  in 720p enjoy. As Always please comment so I know if these are uploading right. Like this will be my first time trying to include a .srt file well see if it makes it , wish me luck!

Storyline:  
This all takes place in the forgotten back-allies of San Francisco's Chinatown in the mid- '80s:
When trucker Jack Burton (Kurt Russell) agreed to take his friend Wang Chi (Dennis Dun) to pick up his fiancÃƒÂ©e at the airport, he never expected to get involved in a supernatural battle between good and evil. Wang's fiancÃƒÂ©e has emerald green eyes, which make her a perfect target for an immortal sorcerer named Lo Pan (James Hong) and his three invincible cronies. Lo Pan must marry a girl with green eyes so he can regain his physical form. Now, Jack must save Wang's fiancÃƒÂ©e from Lo Pan and his henchmen, and win back his stolen truck. But how can he defeat an enemy who has no body?

Main Cast: 
Kurt Russell ==== Jack Burton
Kim Cattrall ==== Gracie Law
Dennis Dun ==== Wang Chi
James Hong ==== David Lo Pan

Compatibility: 
Works on my Sammie 46" 7100 Series 3D 1080p LED HDTV. I can hook my WD Passport {or even a memory stick}  hard drive up to the USB connection {on the input panel} and it works. I personally run it through my Sammie Blu Ray player {through the front USB port} so I can use my Onyko TX-SR875 Audio/Video Processor for better sound and picture. Plug and Play no conversion necessary!

Plays With: WMP {11}, PowerDVD, Nero Kwik Media, QuickTime, and played it on my Droid Maxx as is. Haven't tried any others but doesn't seem to have any problems playing on whatever I open it with it's .MP4 should play on most anything.
